Description: Necklace: composed of many tiny disc beads of gold, a broken cornelian long barrel bead, a rectangular strip of gold pierced by two holes and a flat gold double crown-on-basket amulet with roughly incised details and a back suspension loop.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qaw el-Kebir, Grave 7930 Found at the neck of a woman
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: bangles (1924,1013.82 & 1924,1013.83), beads (1924,1013.87), seal, shell and beads (1924,1013.69). Bibliography: G. Brunton, 'Qau and Badari' I (London, 1927), 37, 38; pl.XLV; Tomb register, pl.LXIV; C. Andrews, 'Amulets of Ancient Egypt' (London, 1994), fig.62
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (335)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
